text: 750 ml. no bottling date. Clear copper-brown with a spit and a ring of creamy foam. Nose is molasses, whole grain bread,chocolate and lightly tart apple. Tastes of molasses, chocolate, whole grain toast, orange, cherry and toasted nut with the bitter pith. Some dried grass and cured tobacco in the long finish. Medium-heavy body has low-medium carbonation and strikes a delicate balance.
Une excellente bière digne des Trois Mousquetaires. Une succulent mélange de caramel, chocolat, épices, dattes et dautres saveurs qui en fait une bière à boire et reboire.
Przypomina quadrupla. Lekko alkoholowy aromat. Suszone owoce, intensywny banan, karmel. Lekka cierpkość na finiszu. Fajne, bogate.
Sampel butelki w Chmielarni. Bardzo przyjemne piwo, mocno zahacza o belgijskiego quada. Są suszone owoce, karmel, melasa. Bardzo smaczne.

Dark beige weak head. mahogany colour. Aroma is malty with fruity (dates, prunes and some dried fruits), caramel and light alcohol notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (prunes, dates and walnuts) and light alcohol tones, ending in a fruity finish. Medium to full bodied.

Rami Rami is drinking a Doppelbock Grande Cuvée (2016) by Les Trois Mousquetaires - LTM at Chmielarnia Marszałkowska

Ciemne owoce, melasowe,chleb, karmel, bananow ciut, tostowo, ciut opiekanie, o dziwo quadowe nieco wrazenia, alko schowane, gladkie, slodkie
Bottle. Sweet with bready, raisin and sugary notes, nice caramel and light chocolate in aftertaste (light iron note too). Medium body, moderate carbonation, finish with light bitterness.
On tap at BBF. Brown colour with tan head. Caramel and malt aroma. Caramel, malt, chocolate and sweet taste. Medium body.
Karamel bruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig fruitig, vanille, mout, perzik. Smaakt zoetig, vanille, zacht, mout. Lekker zoetig.
Ruikt niet zo lekker, muf en iets zurig. Wel mooi en lekker. Zoet en smaakvol. Beetje alcoholisch.

Ma note parle delle-même je crois... La version que je déguste actuellement est celle de 2015 et elle est divine. Jaime bien cette bière fraîche mais à un an dâge, cest aussi succulent. Pruneaux, chocolat, caramel, dattes et épices composent le délicieux palais. La finale est faite de malts délicieux mais que je ne saurais distinguer. Merci pour ce nectar.

Dopplebocks in general are billed as liquid bread for German monks, but what I want to know, who are these Bavarian monks who sit around sipping beer like this in place of bread? On a quest to answer this question, I drove an hour from my home on the U.S. side of the Quebec border to Brossard in order to locate this brewery, which I did, in a non-descript industrial park. Once inside, I did not find any beer-drinking monks, although did find a friendly staffer who was happy to sell me a bunch of 750-ml corked and caged bottles to bring back home for my own early-winter beer tasting. Tonights sampling is their dopplebock, which is exquisite; I actually prefer this to any of the dopplebocks from Germany that Ive had. 

It pours a translucent deep amber-caramel color  which is gorgeous when held up to the light  with a small foamy head, but rapidly settles with no lacing.

The aroma is intriguing. Theres no one scent that stands out, but with multiple whiffs I detect all of the following, in no particular order: cherries, dates, figs, raisins, molasses, caramelized sugar, nuts (almond and hazelnut), candied blood orange, and fresh-baked anadama bread.

The flavor is all of the above, along with vanilla, chocolate, brandy, rum, and pipe tobacco. It is sweet, yet not cloyingly so, balanced by the subdued boozy warmness that follows. 

It is a full-bodied beer with a soft, silky mouthfeel. 

This is a monk-worthy meal in a bottle.

Hazed brown pour, couple fingers of fizzy dense tan head, good retention, leaves no lace. Nice mix in the aroma, lots of dark fruit, brad, toffee, chocolate. Some more spice comes through int he flavour. held back a bit by some excess alcohol heat. Sweet throughout though a bit more balanced at the end.

Shared 750 ml. bottle poured to a snifter displaying a deep amber hue, with a presentable layer of tan foam, and ribbons of lacing. The nose was Eisbock-like scent to the maltiness, with some toastiness, ginger bread-like character, artificial fruit, and spice. Medium+ bodied, with moderate carbonation, the taste offered caramel sweetness, some warmth, with a sherry-like nature.

Veiled copper color with a strong amount of activity. Frothy light orange 2 finger head, lasting around 5 to 10 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas and flavors of caramel, toffee, molasses, dark fruits, citrus, esters, oak, nuts, cocoa, floral and herbal spices. Super flavorful and delicious with a strong thick sugary and light earthy feel, with notes of bread and wood.

Smooth creamy light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Strong and long finish, ending with a vinous sugary, molassy, and fruity tongue coat with lingering yeasty spices, and a smoky wood barrel aged feel.

Overall an excellent craft offering complex and powerful flavors with a pleasant sugary vinous feel while remaining fresh. Excellent warming appetizer similar in taste to a Port wine. Although the strong spices may not please to everyone.

Bottle 75cl
@ Cervezas Diferentes, Coslada, Spain.
A: Dark brown.
T: Malt, caramel, chocolate.

750 ml bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with a small light beoge head. Rich caramel nose, typical roasted malt aroma, sweet sherry. Rich sweet full body, nice subtle bitterness. Flavour of salty caramel and caramel malt. Top notch.

Aroma of dried fruits (plum, fig, raisin) caramel, candy sugar, port like. Flavour of dried fruits and caramel. Smooth body, medium carbo. Sweet caramel carbo medium bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nez très caramel, sauce soja.
Bouche sirop dérable, caramel, épicée, peu épaisse. Fond chocolat, biscuit. Équilibré.
Un modèle du genre comme je les aime.
Tofe, tostado especiado, punto frutal y lupulado. Subida de levadura para mi gusto., lo q la saca un poco del estilo. Si. Así buena birra.
UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Bottle - Vintage 2012 - Dark malts and toffee notes. Cloudy brown with a decent light beige head. Lots of raisin and toffee sweetness. Touch of prune.

Dark brown mahogany. Cherries, toffee, chocolate and coffee in the nose. Sticky slightly sweet malty mouth that is super smooth and rounded (granted this is a 2009 bottle). Minimal hop character. Dark cherries, dark chocolate, milk chocolate, plums and toffee in the mouth. This has aged friggin amazingly. Smooth lingering toffee and chocolate finish.
Nice copper pour with a fizzy tan head. No lacing. Tons of flavours! Breads, yeasts, spices come in strong along with some orange peel, zest, caramel, and sweet herbs.

.75 bottle. Brown / dark brown with a reddish shine. Malty, slightsweet, dark fruity, bit porty, madeirran, ripe figsy, syrupy bready cakey nose. Med full bodied, bitters in finish. Sweetness, intense, old, refined. A sipper with complexity.-- bb
Sabor muy alcohólico, tonos a madera, cereal, miel, tostado, caramelo tostado. Persistente el sabor y muy potente. Para tomar muy despacio y compartir con varias personas.

Degustée après 12 mois en bouteille. Robe acajou assez trouble, col de mousse beige très éphémère. Dentelle quasi inexistante, ce qui annonce une texture légère. Arômes de sucre dorge, baies confites, raisins et pruneaux seches et mélasse en premier lieu avec un fond de muscade et caramel salé. Cest doux, légèrement épicé et aucune trace dalcool. En bouche, sucre dorge, raisins secs, pruneaux, baies confites ainsi quun côté plus citronné venant des houblons mais sans pour autant prendre trop de place. Suivent des saveurs plus amères de chocolat noir, de mélasse et de zeste dorange. Un arrière-goût de muscade et de malt caramélisé. Texture un peu légère compensé par un corps envoûtant et riche. Un goût dune douceur incroyable, haut taux dalcool imperceptible. Prenez une gorgée après avoir croqué dans un morceau de chocolat noir. Sûrement la meilleure représentation de ce style au Québec et à un prix dérisoire.

Bottle gifted to me from Hippyhop -- thanks again, man! -- in a gift box that included a fabulous selection of high end Quebec brews. Pours into the glass a deep brown with cherry highlights. A foamy cap that slowly simmers away to a fine film. A fantastic Doppelbock, clearly world class & better than any Ive tried. I get figs, burnt brown sugar, pumpernickel,  wet pipe tobacco, fresh baked tourtière, & vinous port. Not as sweet as some reviewers suggest. Fantastic mouthfeel, starts soft with a prickly middle & smooth finish. Opened this bottle the night before my first pay cheque in 8 months (paternity leave blues) & just as the Toronto late summer heat wave cracked into a cooler evening that was made for sipping world class Doppelbock. Cheers.

Poured from bottle. Aroma of candied fruit and roasted malt. Pours a dark reddish brown with off-white head. Taste is medium sweet. Full bodied with sticky texture and a long finish. Great brew, but may be too sweet for some.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a dark ruby with off white head. Nice aroma of dark fruits, brown sugar and caramel. Taste is full bodied clingy and syrupy mouthfeel. Flavors of raisins, plums, caramel, toffee, maple syrup, brown sugar, herbal notes. Overall an excellent dopplebock. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1 year old 750ml bottle from local IGA. Aroma: candide fruits, sugar candies, caramel, molasses. App: cloudy brown reddish, minimal white head. Taste and palate: full body, liquoreux, medium to high sweetness, finish is fruity and sweet. Overall: not exactly my style but can sure realize its well done. This one was aged for a year so my rating might be off a bit, maybe more liquoreux than usual.
750ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of frothy head. Lots of caramel sugar and some toffee.

Amber colour and delicate head on top. Aroma has malt bread, dried fruits, syrup and brown sugar. Taste is really sweet. Brown sugar, caramel and syrup. Some malt flavours and hint of alcohol. Almost full body and medium carbonation. Really sweet and bold doppelbock, but I like sweet things.
Sweet and thick. Basic kick that youd expect from a bock. Distant reminder of ryebread. Great for after a great meal.

Pour is chestnut brown with a creamy, fairly persistent tan cap. Nose is chocolate, bread/roasted grain, dark fruit, burnt sugar. Taste is a very sweet, dark, sugary malt with no bitterness until the very end, where it shows up to balance the sweetness before it gets cloying. Faint lingering alcohol on the finish but otherwise this is amazingly unboozy for such a sweet, high alcohol malt. Really nice stuff.
Ölföreningen 2015. Smak och doft av plommon, katrinplommon, torkad frukt, malt med toner av vanilj. Stor sötma, rund och len, fina smaker och beska.
Flaska från SAveur-bier drucken med ölföreningen. En stor maltsöt dubbelbock. Stor maltsöt smaker med mycket torkad frukt, vanilj, plommon, körsbärsgodis, trocadero. Riktigt gott men väldigt sött.
Bouteille de 750ml. Arôme sucré subtil. Mousse fin qui sefface rapidement. En bouche, cest vinifié et sucré. Finale dalcool.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2016 2011 cork bottle reviewed in 2011. Pours a deep chesnut topped by a finger or so of light beige head showing average retention and some faint lacing. The nose is dark ripe fruit, molasses, banana, cookie dough or sweet dark banana bread. The same breadiness come through the taste with sweet chocolate, molasses and bananas. The hops dont get much room as the malts dominate the palate all the way through, but the Hellertau shows up at the end. Medium finish, quite round on the tongue, and a slight bitterness. Cheers!

Bottle. Pours black with a quickly disappearing brown head that leaves no lacing. Aroma of caramel and hay. Medium to heavy sweet, average carbo, oily texture, medium to full body, flavors of brown sugar, chocolate and dark roasted malts leading to a brief sweet syrupy finish.
Poured from the tap. Cloudy reddish brown with off-white to beige head. Lots of caramel and dark ripe fruit. Mild alcohol.
Bottle(26-Jan-2015)Big sweet spirit fruit malt.Dark brown,good head ringed lace.Sweet spirit fruit choc malt flavour.Sweet spice malt finish&choc spirit spice aftertaste.

Pours an opaque chestnut /ruby color with a medium tan head. Aroma has notes of fig and prune...some brown sugar and mild booziness. Flavor follows suit but opens up some more with earthy/leathery notes...some underlying chocolate is peeking through. Mouthfeel is full and silky with an earthy/roasty dry finish.

4oz on tap at Libertys, for $3.50. Mostly clear red brown color, thin ring of khaki head, dots and bits of lace. Up front, dark fruit, raisin, chocolate, big nuttiness, and a touch of licorice. Kind of sweet, but an impressively potent aroma. Bigger body. Smooth, kind of chewy, lighter carbonation. Lightly slick. Good, full feel. Love the chocolate and mild raisin in the aftertaste. Bigger sweet taste, but not cloying. Mildly spicy. Mild bitter. Solid, tasty, impressive but sweeter doppelbock.

Bière orangée coiffée dune mousse quelque peu fugace. Nez puissant de mélasse, de fruits confits et de sucre dorge. En bouche, cest tout aussi puissant et complexe : sucre, fruits rouges, cassis, prune. Explosion de saveurs. Excellente.

Pours a hazy deep amber colour with mild red highlights. Big frothy beige head that lasts long with some foamy lace. Lots of raisins and plums in the aromas. Eventually, yeast come out with some spices and mild hops. Sweet flavours with the dark fruits and hints of chocolate. Caramel blended with the light grassy hops. Good brew, but a little too much for such a big bottle. The sweetness does not help.

Rating #1063 - April 23, 2014 - Bottle from Coop. Rich blackbrown pour with a creamy tan head that bubbles away quickly. Aroma is roast malts, hint of chocolate and weak coffee, mild nuttiness (almond). Mild carbonation, medium-heavy alcohol warmth, little yeasty whiff as well. Palate is more malt character, nutty, chocolatey. Velvety texture that is almost dream-like.

Draft @ SBWF 2014. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy dark fruit aroma. Sweetish malty caramel and dark fruit flavor. Has a sweetish malty caramel and dark fruit finish.

750ml bottle. Deep burgundy with a frothy beige head. Flavors are toasted bread, chocolate, toffee, molasses, raisins and plums with herbal and vinous notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, sticky texture.

Bottle. Pours near clear dark mahogny in color with a tan head. Brown sugary sweetness, bit of dark cake, some malty notes and cocoa in aroma. Roasted malty taste with notes of sweet toffee and dark fruits. More leaning to the chocolate in the end though. Malty finish. Decent.

Sample at SBWF 2014. 

Dark brown with a medium head. Sweet with dried fruit, malt, caramel, hops and light spices. I must say that I like this brewery.
Sample at SBWF 2014. Hoppy perfume aroma, hay, floral, grassy, citrus, slightly spicy. Hoppy grapefruit flavor, grassy, hay, floral, citrus, spicy. Clean and very drinkable.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2014 Aroma is rich caramel, raisins and sweet malts. Taste is like aroma in that the very deep complex sweet malts work so well and finish smoothly. Very light clove bitterness. Appearance is a deep mirky amber with a medium pearl head that retains fairly well.

Bottle bought @ bierkompass.de. Pours ruby reddish dark brown with a frothy and creamy beige head that slowly dissipates while leaving some trace on the glass. Smell is malty and tiny floral with sweet dark bread, caramel, toffee, raisins, prunes, butterscotch, hay, flower nectar and orange zest. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and tiny floral with sweet dark bread, caramel, toffee, honey, golden syrup, raisins, prunes, alcohol, hay and orange zest. Mouthfeel is round, sticky sweet, very tiny watery, tiny boozy and medium bodied. finish is sweet, tiny bitter, malty and tiny floral with sweet dark bread, caramel, toffee, honey, prunes, hay and orange zest. Amazing nose but the taste gets a bit too sweet and isnt really supported by the mouthfeel. Great stuff yet though

(Bottle) Pours dark brown with deep red highlights. Nougat coloured head. The aroma is heavily malty with deep caramel and dark bread. Bit earthy and light noble hoppy. The flavour is sweet, light bitter and tiny acidic with notes of bread, caramel, noble hops, some fruit and light honey. The mouthfeel is clean and sticky with a soft carbonation. Bread and honey on the finish. Medium bodied.

750ml bottle. Pours dark brown with big ruby highlights and a small aerated beige head. Aromas are sweet - toffee, cherry, dates, fresh baked bread, but without the expected banana bread. Taste is also very sweet, with cherry, plum, treacle, expected strong malt backbone and a light mandarin note that fizzes on the tongue. Oily, full bodied. Good depth of flavour but a little oversweet. Enjoying this but think I will struggle to drink the whole 750ml bottle - shouldve saved it to share.
Orangebraunes Bier mit geringer beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, leicht alkoholisch. Geschmack sehr malzig, süß, leicht röstmalzig.

Bottle 2013 vintage from Dresden, thanks buddy! Beautiful dark caramel pour that is loaded with thick lightly tanned head. Aroma is bread like malts, rich spices, dough, and toffee. Holy sugar bomb, lots of sweetness up front, catches you off guard at first, but after a few sips the taste grows on you. Big syrupy mouthfeel, rich toffee sweetness, smooth finish, with some light bitterness in the background and some lingering sweetness. Nice beer, very appropriate for the fall weather were having close to,cloying for sweetness but still good.

Clear brown/ruby with a tanned head. Strong dark fruit with a nice caramel aroma and some chocolate note, hint of roasted malt. Taste is mainly sweet with some bitterness in the aftertaste but ending on sweet fruity notes. Oily brew with a medium carbonation. Another great beer from the 3 mousqueteer!
Süß würziger Antrunk, etwas schokoladig, zuckrig. Nicht wirklich rund, die Süße überdeckt viele Aromen. Minimale Herbe, röstig. Gefällt mir nicht. 9/7/6/6/9/6

Couleur brune, completement translucide et avec peu de mousse. Au nez au décèle un liquide assez complexe de caramel et de fruits. En bouche le caramel mene le bal accompagné de plusieurs fruits comme les bananes,oranges,prunes,fruits rouges. Assez complexe. Un peu trop sucré pour moi. Corps moyen. Carbonation moyenne et moyenne amertume. Correct mais pas mon genre!

750 ml bottle shared with Steve
Lovely aroma strong malt 
Best do pple bock I have had

Bouteille de 750ml achetée chez IGA. Couleur brun-rubis avec très légère mousse beige. Odeur sucrée, rhum, prune, pain. Goût un peu trop prononcé dalcool. Sinon rhum, malt rôti, caramel brûlé. Palais sec, légère effervescence et arrière goût de rhum. Cest définitivement parmi les chef doeuvre brassicole québécois.

750 ml bottle from rare beer club. Pours light brown with tall, long lasting, fluffy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of ripe plums, sour cherries, caramel malt and hint of herbal hops. Body is full and slightly crisp. Taste is very fruity (plums, cherries), caramel malt, brown sugar, herbal hops. Finish is long, sweet first then becomes dry and herbal. Very complex, interesting brew.

Bottle from Rare Beer Club. Pours murky brown with head that dissipates quickly to nothing. Beautiful aroma of caramel, candied fruit, toffee, bread. Taste brings along chocolate and a spritz of cherry cola. Sweet from start to finish, with just the tiniest bit of bitterness surfacing in the finish. Long finish of cherries and caramel. Medium-full body, chewy thick texture, average carbonation. Overall: this is delicious. Its definitely sweeter than my favorite doppelbocks, but it otherwise hits all the right flavor notes. Would definitely drink again.

750ml bottle. Pours a dark ruby caramel with with a one finger, tan head. Aroma has lots raisin, dark fruits, and caramel. Taste is a balanced sweet with some candy sugar, dark fruits, and caramel. Medium-full body and carbonation. Slightly prickly on the tongue with a slightly syrupy texture. Overall a tasty brew. Lots of dark fruit and caramel with a fuller body and prickly carbonation.
750ml bottle. Tasted some citrus and chocolate flavours in there. Solid beer, recommended.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 On tap at La Boîte à Malt. Pours a medium brown with a really thin white head that leaves great lacing. Nose is of sugary raisins, brown sugar. Taste is cloyingly sweet and provides good grapes and treacle flavors. Body is full, mouthfeel really sticky. Carbonation is light. Not bad, just too damn sweet.

Clear amber pour with a thin creamy beige head ..... aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, some candied sugar with dark fruits (plums) and notes of spicy rye  ..... taste of roasted malts, chocolate malts and dark fruits (plums) with notes of rye .... bready and full bodied ... .has a slight abv to it .... finish is dry and has a lingering sweetness with a roasted, dark fruit flavors .... definitely full bodied and a meal in its own

750 mL bottle. 8% alcohol, 2011 "vintage." Medium dark brown, opaque, red tinge, some bubbles and particulate matter. Aroma is pretty intense, purple fruits, caramel malt, butterscotch, chocolate, Medium body. Not much alcohol. Creamy mouthfeel. Quite sweet and fruity, grapey almost. Malt candy. Nice complexity, but for me too sweet with nothing to balance it.
bouteille de 750 ml de brune. arome de rhum prune et danis. tres douce en bouche beaucoup sucré. tres intéressant et explosif comme gout et odeure

Bottle. Potent cereal grain and faintly estery aroma with some spicy melanoidins and nutty accents. Hazy dark bronze-garnet under a large tan island and lacy ring. Sweet cereal grain flavour with a vinous sourness and modest hops bitterness and plenty of nut accents along with some horehound. Medium to full body, medium carbonation, almost clean finish.

Bottle - 2011 edition. Pours clear deep ruby black with a large creamy tan head that dissipates slowly with nice lacing. Very malty aroma, dark sugars, molasses, chocolate, fruitcake. Flavor is medium sweet and very tasty, dark fruits, dark sugars, fruitcake, pumpernickel bread. No real bitterness per se. Fullish body, creamy mouthfeel. Hella nice lager.

Draught at St. Augustines, VancouverDark brown color, unclear apparently, with small compact head. It has a very strong character of rye, both the aroma and flavor, really unusual in Doppelbocks; it also has a considerable residual sweetness; the dark malts come with some acidity.Liquid pumpernickel; not bad, but unexpected and strange.

Precioso color rubí oscuro con espuma color crema. Aromas de frutas confitadas, azúcar moreno y un toque de licor. En boca entra suave y con cuerpo medio, los sabores dulces y afrutados se van mexclando con otros ligeramente ácidos e igualmente cargados de fruta. Un ligero gusto tostado y a madera también están presente. Muy rica.
Bottle (8.6% ABV). Pour is dark brown with a small khaki colored head. Aroma is of toffee, ripened fruits, and wood. Flavor has some more biscuit/bread but is mostly the same as the nose.

750 ml bottle. Produced on 11/2012. 8.6%. Courtesy of laiti.
Dark reddish brown colour with a small tan head. 
Strong sweet maltiness and bread in the aroma. 
Very sweet and super malty flavour. Quite true to the German Doppelbock.

750 ml bottle, thanks laiti. Pours a dark brown colour with a small head. Aroma of toasted malts, bread, raisins and some syrup. Flavour of toasted malts, raisins, wooden notes, grass, bread and some alcohol. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden. Finishes sweet, malty, grassy. Well balanced.

750ml bottle

Pours dark brown with a foamy head. Aroma of bready malts, spicy notes, hints of chocolate, roastiness and yeast. Taste is warming, bready malty and spicy with hints of sweet syrup, caramel and chocolate. Finish is malty, bready and heavy with some syrupy sweetness and caramely notes. Heavy and complex doppelbock, a bit unbalanced.

75 cl bottle (8,6%) @ Tampella, produced 11/2012
Aroma has strong malty notes, bread, cocoa and chocolate. Also some berry notes. Flavour has syrupy tones, lots of malt, bread and some berries. Feels a bit tart. Very rich, hides the ABV well.

75 cl bottle, 8.6% abv.
Pours clear dark copper-brown color with a medium head. Aroma is extremely malty, some caramel, bread, nuts, ripe fruits and some wood. Flavor is also bready and malty, lots of caramel, hay, some toffee notes, yeast and faint nutty notes. Somewhat bitter malty palate with a creamy chocolaty finish. A bit watery feel to it though, alcohol hidden very well.
5325
Way way way too sweet, some acetone in there too, meh pass... No thank u. I dont like this much

On tap at Frisco Tap House & Brewery in Columbia, MD. 

Hazy, dark brown with a small khaki head and good lacing. 

Aroma of toffee, prunes and raisins. 

Taste of toffee, roasted chocolate malt, prunes and raisins. 

Medium/full body and low/medium carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It pours ruby coloured with mahogany highlights; the head is beige and foamy. The aroma has notes: raisins, molasses, pumpernickel, licorice, and ruby-fruit marmalade. The taste is heavy sweet that finishes light bitter; there are notes of: the aforementioned aroma notes. The palate is medium-full bodied, sticky, has low carbonation, and a long sweet finish. Overall, pretty good, albeit a little simple.
(bottle) clear reddish brown colour with a tall brown head; aromas of bread, prunes, chocolate liqueur; sweet, rich flavour with a long light bitter finish; excellent

750 mL bottle. Pours dark amber with a foamy tan head that leaves no trace. Aromas of fruitcake, rum, candied orange, chocolate and demerara. Fairly sweet and firm bodied, moderate to heavy carbonation and full on the palate. Leaves a lingering sticky sweetness on the palate, gently offset by a touch of acidity and woody hop spice. Liquid bread indeed!

Pours dark unclear deep amber with a beige head. Aroma is malty and a bit sweet like a barleywine, but tamer with no booze. Flavor is tame as well for booze. I get big yeasty notes that are sweet, a bit fruity, and again, resembling a barleywine style.

2009 bottle. Dark brown pour with a tan head. Sweet roasted malt aromas with notes of coffee and dark fruit. Flavor is big toasted malt with chocolate and brown sugar notes. Very sweet, abv is well hidden too. Tasty brew, great example of the style.

Bottle, bought @ Beer City, Belgium. Pours clear chestnut with a small, creamy, beige film head. Aroma has sweet milky chocolate, toasted, light vinious, soft pepper. Medium carbonation, very creamy and light grainy mouthfeel. Flavour has lots of chocolate, toasted, raisins. Lots of malty bitterness. Lovely.

2013/09/10 - Pour a hazy, dark mahogany colour, with a soapy, khaki coloured head that reduces to a surface film and lingers. Minimal lacing. Aroma is bread, molasses, spices and dark fruits. Taste is similar to nose with a very sweet, malty aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium and sticky with smooth carbonation and a sharp, sweet malt finish. Almost cloyingly sweet...wished I had aged it to mellow out the flavours. Still, a good representative of the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2015 Bière brune foncée aux reflets rouge-orangés à la lumière, bien voilée, bonne effervescence, et surmontée dun col brunâtre plutôt étroit et moyennement dense qui se stabilise tout juste à la surface du liquide. Arômes de pain grillé et grain rôti avec tout de même beaucoup de sucres foncés (mélasse, caramel, cassonade). Aussi, quelques effluves fumés et terreux, feuille morte, se dégagent également du liquide, ainsi que des pointes de fruits foncés (raisin, prune/pruneau) et dépices (clou de girofle, muscade, piment de la Jamaïque). Lalcool est également subtilement présent au nez, ainsi quune dose assez évidente desters de fermentation (beaucoup de banane très mûre, tendance gomme balloune, limite excessif, solvant), et une certaine acidité vinaigrée un peu étrange. Nez tout de même bien agréable, très complexe, intensité plutôt moyenne cependant. En bouche, pétillement assez élevé sur la langue, onctuosité intéressante au palais, cest moelleux, velouté et liquoreux. Au goût, on note dabord que cest significativement moins sucré que ce que le nez laissait présager, malt bien céréalier de pain grillé et grain rôti, avec saveurs de caramel, mélasse, chocolat brun et cassonade. Saveurs terreuses, tourbe, feuille morte, herbes semi-séchées, légère fumée, légère épices, fruits foncés bien sucrés voire confits (pruneaux surtout). Aussi, goût évident dalcool mais cest agréable et bien intégré aux autres saveurs, et esters et notes vinaigrées bien plus subtils quau nez (heureusement!). Saveurs houblonnées assez difficile à cerner (on est probablement dans la terre, lherbe et les épices), et finale à lamertume plutôt faible. Excellente intégration des différentes saveurs entre elles, bière très complexe, intensité en bouche supérieure par rapport au nez. Très bonne bière! /// Le brasseur mentionne un potentiel de vieillissement de 3 à 5 ans pour cette bière. Jai laissé vieillir une bouteille 3 ans en cellier et le résultat fut fort intéressant. Breuvage moins effervescent et pétillant, mais plus épais, onctueux, presque sirupeux. Explosion des flaveurs maltées, en particulier la compote de prune et lanis, la bière semble bien plus sucrée, moins céréalière, herbacée, épicée et alcoolisée. Les notes doxydation se marient très bien aux autres saveurs. Beau résultat! Ça vaut la peine dêtre patient!

Aroma is fairly deep roast cocoa malt, moderate alcohol, pungently floral.  Taste seems a bit sour and dry - roasty and herbal, somewhat boozy, a hint of lemon (7-).  Average body, mild carbonation, decidedly dry, acidic and a bit boozy - decent, but the hint of dry sourness detracted from it for me, I would have liked a bit more sweet roastiness.

bottle. after a long 30 hours of drinking and eating, then not eating because i had to fast for 12 hours then eating and drinknking then coming home. this is nice. not sure why im sneezing, but this smells lovely burnt marshmallow with a strong caramel and roasted peanut scent. attractive dark brown pour with a lasting brown/white head. a bit on the sweet side for my tastes. sugary and syrupy with a dash of honey. but get under that ad the enjoyable caramel and light roast come alive. unfortunately it is hard to get to. this is like a twix candy bar sweet ovr enjoyable dough that does not give up. however the finish is about perfect. if this had a minimal hop presence it could be awe inspiring.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06 at the RBSG Grand Tasting. Thanks! Ive always wanted to try these guys... cool. Pours a murky brown color with a medium brown head. Good head retention and lacing. The aroma is nuts and toffee with caramel and a light tart note. The taste is toffee, caramel, nutty notes and sunflower. Medium bodied.
Dark brown pour, thick, short light tan head.  Dark sweet malts, caramelized sugars, nuts, bread, raisins, and plum.  Very tasty doppelbock.

750 ml bottle. Vintage 2009. Pours a thin beige head, of short duration, over a clear, reddish brown (SRM 25) body.....nose is yeast (Boveril, Marmete) leading to beefy tones, then raisin, plum, brown sugar, light chocolate.....taste is sweet plum, raisin, to start then layers of mince pie, plum pudding, finishing with a lingering beefy, yeast sweetness.....mouth feel is thick and sticky, carbonation medium to low. This is an excellent Doppelboch. It has the rich complexity of malt back bone in aroma and flavor it should have. BJCP 7/3/16/5/8

Nose jumps out.  Starts fruity, then licorice, then chocolate.  Appearance is brown but in the light is extremely red.  Thick head, not a great lacing pattern.   Palate at start (cooler temps) a tiny bit thin.  Candied fruit, sugars, esters, a bit of a resinous feel, then some caramel and more candied fruit.  Really nice, would like to age one of these.  Had never heard of this brewer.

The pour is a rusty, dark ruby color with a moderately full, fluffy, pillowy, tan head which is mostly diminishing and leaves minimal lace.  The nose is interesting for the style with a definite rauch-type smoke note, some beechwood, candied raisins, dark toffee, some molasses, and some cake-like notes with spicing to match.  The flavor is similar with the rausch and beechwood notes still prominent but never dominant, candied raisins and dates, and some lighter notes of chocolate, toffee, and faint coffee roast.  The palate is nearly full, nearly lively, slightly warm, and velvety but a bit dry.  The finish is a bit dry considering the flavor notes, some light toffee still, more roast (almost earthy), some beechwood, and still some cake.  This was one of the better doppels Ive tried in a while. The multifaceted complexities were unique to the style and the smoke and wood notes were complementary to the malt richness.  The darker roast tones came later in the flavor progression and added a bit of bitterness to the beer, which was nice.  A non-prototypical doppel with the strength and odd complexities but seemingly, it all worked well together to create something memorable.

Glossy brown, tan head.  Nose of pumpernickel with a smidgen of smoke.  Flavors are somewhat meaty with a touch of sweet pumpernickle underneath...actually, maybe a touch too sweet. Somewhat chalky in the finish..but body is sufficiently thick. Decent, but on the sweet side.

750ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, chocolate, black bread, and a hint of caramel.  Poured mahogany/very deep amber/brown in color with a medium-sized, tan/light brown head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Flavor is medium to heavily sweet.  Tastes of malt, chocolate, slight dark ripe fruit, caramel, wood, and some bread.  Medium body.  Slick, then lightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, chocolate, and light wood finish is dry and light to medium sweet.  9.5%ABV is completely hidden throughout.
Bottle, pours dark brown / black with a big beige head. Aroma of caramel malts. Flavour is extremely strong roasted malt, candied fruits and subtle chocolate. Extremely nice.

Bottle from Smittys.  Pours burnt sienna w 3f creamy tan head.  Nose is earthy malt, brown sugar, fig.  Tastes of charred malt, brown sugar, cacao, hops, on the dry side,, with a richm, complex palate.  This one is a top notch DB.

Bouteille de 750 ml.  La couleur est brune foncée avec des reflets rouges.  Le col de mousse est solide et laisse rapidement des traces collantes aux parois du verre.  Le nez est sollicité par des effluves de malts rôtis (léger chocolat).  Présence étonnante de tabac et/ou dépices.  Forte présence de sucre caramélisé et de fruits foncés.  Pas de houblons dans les arômes.   Au niveau du goût, la bouche est dabord dominée par le sucre de petits fruits macérés.  On note aussi une touche de mélasse.  Degré dalcool habilement caché.  La finale se fait longue sur des notes très douces et fruitées.  Présence de léger houblon au goût mais complètement dominé par les différents grains maltés.  Le liquide possède une musculature solide et une texture moyennement riche.  En résumé, version saisissante proposée par le brasseur.

Really outstanding. Poured with a huge tan thick foamy frothy head that slowly settles down and some lace. Color is a clear (?) very dark cherry wood. Aroma is excellent with roast malt licorice pipe tobacco caramel rye. Flavor is like aroma plus even more: cocoa nutmeats. I like the sweetness of it pretty much as thats according to style; however, it is perhaps just a tad too sweet. Body is superb and so is carbonation just according to style. Finish is like flavor and again perhaps a tad sweet, but still great. Proly not session.

Bottle. Dark color with some red hues. White head. Quite carbonated. Nose full of sweet malts and fruits. Some caramel and toffee. More digging brings out some candy like sweetness. Flavors of sweet candy, some floral notes as well. Plenty of malts and fruits follow. Maybe a bit too sweet after a half bottle. After getting too warm it becomes sticky and sweet, dont let i get too warm.

2007 750mL bottle.  Poured rich garnety-amber with a creamy, rather dense cap of yellowy-beige head.  The aroma picked up sweet, yet toasty caramel, vanilla, and darker fruit with accents of molasses and earthy spices.. overall candy-like and well-balanced.  The flavor found chewy bread along with vanilla, molasses, caramel, and dark fruit on the rich base.. more dry, toasty sweetness on the edges, picking up some chocolate.. some almond at the end along with candied, desserty sweetnesss.  Medium-bodied, sweet, and a little smoky on the palate.. not the greatest flow, but it was very good.  I really dug this!

Thanks to sebletitje for the share.  Pours red-brown with an off-white head.  Nose is chocolate, tobacco, spice, and some fizzy yeast.  Flavor is similar with some dark fruit and sugary almost molasses.  Almost tasted a hint nutty.  Interesting beer.

750 ml bottle corked and caged; clear cola brown with frothy tan head fading quickly; first aroma is all tootsie rolls; sweet chocolate with a little roast and cloves; smooth, thin body with candy sweet chocolate and caramel; delicate, smooth and delicious

Huge, collapsing dark beige head over ochre-brown, but clear beer. Black chocolate and coffee, "café glacée cookies; bit uniform. Sweet, cookies-like, café glacée again the nail on the head, turning into bitterish,  very roasted coffee. Maybe overroasted mocha. Well bodied and very slick. This is a sweet coffee porter. No German Doppelbock tastes as such - which does in no way make it a bad beer, just a bit of a misnomer.  Grand merci à Dany!

pours dark brown, off-white head.
Aroma and flavors, caramel and chocolate malts with a nice grainy mouthfeel, some spices, and yeasty profile. Picked up some dark fruits with dark sugar.
Tasty brew with a nice sweet side coupled with a good chocolate/caramel finish.
Pours dark brown with tan head. Aromas of toasted malts, caramel and bread dough. Similar flavors with some chocolate and a touch of sweetness. Chewey mouthfeel with moderate carbonation.
suoper dark prune juice color, aroma is sweet and pruney, flavor is very ryeish. Earthy and meaty. Malty and thick. Chewy palate. Bottle from a tasting with Smith4498, Legato, and Cbeers21.

It pours with a huge brown head.  It took me a couple of minutes to pour a pint.  It will eventually subside, but leaves a great lacing on the glass.  The beer itself is dark brown (nearly black) and opaque.  Aroma of roasted malt, french oak and chocolate.  The first taste is notably sweet, but the alcohol does step in to balance this out at the finish.  Obvious notes of caramelized sugar, and hops.  More subtle notes of plum and currant.  This beer has a thick almost viscous feel to it, and is filling.  Truly a meal in a glass.  Overall this is a nice beer for a beer drinker with a sweet tooth.  I personally feel that the only reason this isnt a great beer is because of the potent alcohol taste.  It would really stand out above the rest if it were an 8% ABV beer.

.75 bouteille. Poured dark with moderate head.  This was actually more of a Belgian Dubbel than a Bayerische Doppel, lots of candy and chocolate and alcohol. OK but hard to swig more than a few small glasses.

THOUGHTS: Whoa. Lots o sweetness here. Maybe a little too much. Rather high ABV for the style, but it hid the alcohol, which should be noticeable, a little too much. When I tried this a month and a half ago I was getting a bit sick of rating beers and took a little break from rating until I caught up with inputting my back reviews. Im finally getting that done today. This was very good, if a little sweet. It all came together as it warmed. Very nice in the end. It was nice with Lindor chocolate truffles.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a dark, amber, brown that was nearly black in the glass, but red when backlit. It had a large, foamy, off-white head that mostly diminished and left excellent lacing. The aroma was moderate chocolate and chocolate syrup; ever so slight coffee; light spicy yeast; raisin, prune, cherry, port and alcohol. The initial flavor was rather sweet and somewhat acidic; while the finish was heavily sweet. There was cherry, raisin, alcoho, chocolate syrup, slight coffee, other dark fruit, lots of caramel, a little roasted malt, chocolate, molasses, a little yeast and red wine. It was all slightly watered down. The medium body was rather oily, but a bit creamy and sticky on the lips with soft yet tingly carbonation and a dry and light to moderately alcoholic finish.

Wow, this IS good! Smells slightly of chocolate and berries, sweetly of malt and wood aromas. Quite dark, Very good head, pretty good lacing. Tastes smokey at first, as it goes down the flavour profile changes  A LOT! First it is dark and cool, maybe too cold for the proper flavours to come out, then there is the sweetness of the malt and then it somehow combines the sweetness and the smoke flavour on the end palate so as you swallow it all warms up in your mouth and the flavour REALLY comes out. Fantasitic!

Poors a brown beer with some red touches. Smells caramel, walnuts and a bit of roastiness. Taste the caramel, spices and some trace of chocolat. Little presence of alchool. Gets even better with a year of conservation.

Chitown RB gathering Jan 2010: bottle shared by Shawn, many thanks!  Deep mahogany with a small beige head and spotty lace. The aroma has notes of walnut, caramel, golden raisin, slight peat and smoke, vanilla beans and earthy yeast esters. The taste has a nice malty and dark fruit component balance with smoky wood and sublime spicy tones, hint of dark chocolate as well. The mouth feel is moderately carbonated with a oily and chewy character. Wow, much better than expected. One of better dopplebocks I have had.

Enjoyed at the Flossmoor Station RB tasting, 1/16/2010:  This poured a dark brown body highlighted in ruby and had a modest beige head.  The aroma was dark caramel, cookie dough, cocoa, and a light roastiness.  The flavor had the addition of dark fruit, alcohol, and a soft, balancing earthy bitterness near the end.  Not bad.

Bottle shared at Chicago RB tasting.  Clear mostly brown pour with some hints of red as well.  Lots of caramel malt, hints of alcohol, chocolate, and licorice.  Maybe a lightly fruity character as well.  Solid.

Bottle from glouglouburp and shared at the chicagoland ratebeer tasting.  Pours a clear dark brown with ruby red highlights.  notes of dough, chocolate, candy, caramel, and doughy dark fruit.  Pretty solid beer.  No real complaints.  Great beer.

Pours a nice dark amber brown colour with a large beige head. The aroma is of caramel malts and chocolate along with some nuts and fruits. The taste is sweeter with some hints of alcohol, full bodied and smooth with a long finish. Overall not a favourite but good.

From notes. Dark brown pour, small, dense, off white head. Roasty caramelized malt, bready yeast/grain combo, hints of alcohol, dark dried fruits. Full/medium body, just smoother than balanced. Great doppelbock.

750ml bottle, American version.  Pours a clear, dark, chestnut to mahogany brown color.  A medium, smooth, creamy head of tan foam settles in slowly, leaving behind a sudsy wash of lace that mostly rejoins the body below.  The aroma shows notes of cocoa, fig, burnt caramel, and barley roast, with hints of dark winter spices, vanilla, and booze. Flavors are chocolaty, rich with dry cocoa roast, deepened with notes of caramel, clove, cinnamon, and whispers of fruity bourbon.  Its quite tasty, actually.  The palate is big and smooth, sporting a lively, spritzy carbonation, finishing with lingering, drying sugars.  Very good brew, as Ive come to expect from these guys.

From a 750mL. Courtesy of Travlr. Pours a muddy deep mahogany/cloudy red. Thin off-white head leaves some good lacing. Smells like a bourbon barrel aged brown ale. Lots of rich bourbon and chocolate in the nose. Taste is rich, buttery and heavy with yeast and creaminess. Unlike any doppelbock Ive tried. This is not an unrefined sweet bomb like most attempts of the style.

Dark maroon color with a medium tan head that settles slowly to leave good lacing.
Aroma is reminiscent of a Hershey bar.
Flavor starts with cola, progresses to milk chocolate, then roasted coffee, and finally a finish of burnt espresso.
Good body.
Very nice subtle, complex, smooth doppelbock.

750ml from Bonisoir, Montreal. Handsome pour, chestnut brown with a big rocky head and some prickly carbonation. Moderate lacing, sticky beer overall. Nice bready malts and some nertz in the aroma. The mouthfeel is fairly full, a bit too lively perhaps. Surprisingly the flavors are dominated by chocolate malts through and through, giving the beer a slightly one-dimensional quality. Too, it has a slightly acrid finish that made me wonder about storage conditions. Okay.

750 ml bottle.  Pours a deep dark woody brown and a nice long lasting fluffy beige khaki head- some lace. Aroma is nutty doughy toffee, some toasted malts, mineral and dust, with hints of dry light chocolate, slight cobweb and marzipan.  Flavor is mineral upfront slate on the tongue- ok sweet toasted malts, sharp deep caramel and deep Munich malts, some roast and dark chocolate - some sharp acrid malts, earth, leather, some mineral- iron, lots of big malts, some light fig and dried fruitiness, even with the sweetness it doesnt finish too sweet.  There is a unique mineral and earthiness but is pretty good overall.    Carbonation a bit on the high prickly side- could be lower to help the mouthfeel.

211109 Tasting with Ungdomsklubben. Pours a dark brown with a beige head. Sweet with lots of chocolate aromas. Hints of alcohol. Tiny hints of toasted malts towards the end. Some bread. Full boided with a slightly sticky mouthfeel. Good.

A 750ml bottle poured into a Stem Glass at 45°  Color is a deep rich ruby with good carbonation and a lasting tan head that becomes tighter as you drink it.  Aroma is sweet with malt giving a dried pear and molasses scent.  It starts with an easy full body that has a slick mouth feel going down soft.  Finish comes in sweet with apple, cheery, toffee and yeast then a light bitterness with coffee and a hint of smoke.  After taste is dry with a light bitter that gives way to a sweet alcohol feel.  Wow this is a great brew, very tasty with bold Belgian yeast and fruit flavors.
Bottle at Sunes - Thanks to mikkel for bringing it to Denmark. Clear dark dark brown - offwhite head. Roasted, ryebread, nutty, grassy, soapy, chocolate, caramel, dried fruits. High chocolate aroma.

Bottle at Sune.
Clear red brown coloured with a medium sized beige ehad.
Sweet aroma of caramel, dark chocolate and rye bread.
Sweet flavour of dried fruits, dark chocolate and rye bread.
Sweet finish of chocolate.

Big bottle, shared with Parksy. Pours a beautiful deep mahogany with a long-lived copiously bubbled creamy beige cap. Very toasty aroma, dark caramel, and hints of something vegetal and spicy (aniseed? caraway?). As it breathes, that beguiling spicy/veggie thing faded from my radar. Rich, sweet malty flavours with fruity undertones and roasty bitterness. Chewy mouthfeel, warming finish. A high-ABV doppelbock, but one that immensely satisfies.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 75 cl bottle. Quite different from the other ones. Quite dark with a white head. Lots of roasted coffee aromas, coffee and smoke. Taste is smokey and leathery quite nice, very different from the other dopplebocks.

Brown bottle, 750 ml, 2007 vintage, savoured on October 17 2009; eye: ruby, clear, average effervescence, sheet of beige head that remains, no lacing; nose: light cognac, candied fruits, molasses, light basement, malt, caramel, light dusty; mouth: light cognac, candied fruits, molasses, light basement, malt, light alcohol, slight hops, caramel, dusty, finale in malt with alcohol presence, average carbonation, full body, lightly bitter, mildly sweet, slick texture; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 750 ml, millésime 2007, savourée le 17 octobre 2009; il : rubis, claire, effervescence moyenne, couverture de mousse crémeuse beige qui demeure, pas de dentelle; nez : léger cognac, fruits confits, mélasse, léger cave, malt, caramel, poussière; bouche : léger cognac, fruits confits, mélasse, léger cave, malt, léger alcool, très léger houblon, caramel, poussière, finale en malt avec présence dalcool, carbonatation moyenne, corsé, légèrement amère, moyennement sucrée, coulante; en résumé : très bon

750 ml corked and caged bottle poured a clear dark brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of carmel, brown sugar, dark fruit and cocoa. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of carmel,m molasses, dark fruit and cocoa with a smooth dry malty finish.

Bottle thanks of bu11zeye. The smell is sweet, some alcohol, caramel, malst, and fruits.  The look is reddish to brown in color, clear, with a decent light beige head.  The taste is sweet, malts, fruits, and caramel.

( 750ml bottle 2009 thanks to bu11zeye) Pours dark chocolate brown with great head and lace. Nose of alcohol, sweet chocolate malts. Taste is semi-sweet chocolate, creamy, coffee. Nicely bitter and a little syrupy.

Corked bottle.Pours a rich. lush mahogany with a nice head of light beige.  Aroma is airy smoke and plastic.  Flavor is smoky wood and caramel-infused molasses.  Notes of sweet brown sugar and roasted nut as well.  Thick, full mouthfeel.  Nice, NICE beer.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: ( 750ml bottle, 2009 vintage )  Pours a deep mahogany body with a medium beige head.  Aroma of wood, caramel, roasted grain, cocoa, raisins, and apple skins.  Flavor of smoke, plum, caramel malt, raisins, cocoa, nuts, and wood.

bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured a dark brown with a beige head.  aroma of smoke, caramel, cinnamon, and alcohol.  flavor was smoke, caramel, cinnamon, dark roast, and alcohol.  medium body with high carbonation.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  deep brown with a beige head.  nose is roasted malts and caramel.  not bad on the palate with a definite roasted flavor tagged with creamy caramel.

Printemps 2009
9/17/2009:  Les Trois Mousquetaires Doppelbock... Aroma:  Coffee with some fruity dark fruit.  Appearance:  Extremely deep ruby brown color; large foamy beige head.  Flavor:  Coffee, nutty, hints of chocolate; richly caramelized malts.  Palate:  Medium to medium-full; fairly smooth.  Overall:  Pretty solid; reminds me a bit of the New Glarus Unplugged Old English Porter without the sour aspect.  This stuff could totally get you lit quickly if you arent careful since there is just enough residual sweetness in the malt component to cover the alcohol and make you want more...

750 ml corked and caged bottle ( 9.5% Alc/Vol) shared by Tmoney99.  Thanks Tom!  Rating #84 for this beer.

Bottle Spring 2009 from Keg Liquor.

Poured clear brown color with a huge frothy brown head that lasted with good lacing.  Good roasted chocolate malt and dark fruit aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth thick texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet toasted malt flavor with a medium smooth bittersweet finish of moderate duration.

Very good doppelbock.

Spring 2009 vintage thanks to bu11zeye. Pours with a tan head over a deep, hazy brown body. Aroma of cork, apple, must, and alcohol. Taste is smokey, butter, leather and caramel. Light bubbles, dry mouthfeel.

Bottle courtesy of bu11zeye.  Clear ruby pour with a strong off white head. Very pretty appearance. Lots of sweet malts with a spice of alcohol. Strong aroma. Some chocolate flavoring with a nice roasted coffee ground finish. Reminds me of Sunday school at the old church. This has very few flaws and is quite drinkable.

750 ml bottle shared with my dad 09.08.30 : large fizzy head, excellent lacing, ruby in color. Light molasses, caramel, chocolate note. I can smell herbacy hop. Light alcohol this one would be a nice winter warmer. The after taste is long but pleasant. I can detect dark fruit also. Probably there best of the reserve serie

On tap at Vices et Versa.  Dark, opaque, reddish brown with a short-lived beige head.  The nose is quite malty, with everything from toasted nuts to caramel to chocolate.  The flavour is similar, with the addition of some alcohol, dried fruit and licorice.  Nice body and appropriate carbonation.  Solid doppelbock, and certainly as good as anything Ive had in Canada.
Nice doppelbock. Aroma full of roasted malts, some dark fruits, caramel, and maybe a touch of soy sauce. Roasted flavor, bittersweet chocolate, soy, and coffee. Pretty tasty.
a nice db. Pours very dark brown with foamy head. Sweet and heavy malt. Raisins, candy, burnt fruit. Even some hops in there. Smooth and yummy.

Atlaggie shared this one. Printemps 2009 issue. GC meaning grand cuvee, what we ran out of room when entering the beer? Anyways, pretty nice and on the full roasted malt side of things. Reminds me much of the duck rabbit version of the style. Cocoa, slight sweetness, and a int of alcohol in the aroma. Flavor is sweet as well followed by a nice roasted malt and some chocolate flavors. A little bittersweet cocoa makes this a nice dessert beer.
solan(?) I think brought this to Cigar City.  Brown pour.  Caramel, toffee, nuttiness and some milk chocolate.  Flavor has caramel and chocolate notes with light coffee.  Pretty damn good.

Bottle courtesy of Sammy. Shared with Rudolf & IPFreely. Dark brown pour. Chocolatey aroma with loads of roasted malts. Coffee flavor & aroma also. Nutty, chocolately sweet flavor, Creamy fuller mouthfeel. Very goof dopplebock. Thanks again Sammy

0.75 l bottle at PBF, thanks Timo A! Ruby color. Sweet dark caramel aroma. Sweet, nutty, toasty and warming flavor with notes of dark caramel and coffee. Good dessert beer. Tastes like there was a bit too much dark speciality malts.
Très foncée, cette bière a de fortes notes de chocolat et de caramel. Finale légèrement alcoolisée. Bonne, mais un peu trop débalancée.

750mL bottle from Marche Jovi in Gatineau, 2009 vintage. Pours a deep dark brown, slightly hazy, with a huge tan head. The aroma is very nice, dark and roasty, yet still bready malts, chocomalt, coffee, dark fruits. Very enticing. Flavour starts out intensely sweet, fruit, chocolate, malty to the max but very well balanced in the finish with intense coffee roasty bitterness. Very rich feeling and definitely a sipper. Alcohol is mild but present, lets you know what youre dealing with. Very satisfying as an after dinner drink, though everything about this beer to me says Baltic Porter. Dopplebock is kind of a loose definition of what this beer is. All in all very well done and extremely tasty. Glad I could find it.

Bottle. Pours a dark chocolate brown with a thick tan head with nice lacing. Nose is almost stout-like, big and roasty, surprisingly smoky, but with a nice fruity sweetness as well. Flavours of chocolate, red fruit, smoke, hung meat, a bit boozy, but still exceptionally nice.

Bottle - 750ml, vintage 2009. Pours a cloudy dark brown body with low carbonation and a huge brown frothy head. Wonderful malty/hoppy aroma with brown sugar, yeasty and spicy hints. Alcohol is very well hidden. Its well balanced taste carries plummy, vineous and some oaky notes. Texture is soft and bittersweet finish is long, robust, warming. Excellent Doppelbock.

Bottled at PBF.  Dark brown, brief head. Dep caramelly lingonberry aroma. Sweet and full bodied. Highly warming with mssive amounts of caramel and notes o lingonerry jam. Drier salty finish with soy sauce and saké. A megapotent doppelbock.

Bottled. Ambery brownish ruby colour with small beige head. Aroma is caramel, wood and raisins along with some roasted and herbal notes. Flavour is mild wood, some caramel malts as well as some sweetish berryish notes. Mild burnt notes as well.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2011 Tap at Vices et Versa.  Dark brown beer.  Sticky brown head.  Intensely aromatic nose with a nice herbal-accented cocoa and some clean brown malt.  Toffee and light cocoa over a chewy lightly fruity maltiness.  Some light plums and sweet toasted malts.  Milk chocolate with a bit of herbal/hoppy character.  Not overly sweet at all, just with a nice light toastiness that works very well in this beer.  yup... not a bad choice at all for my last beer in Montreal.

Bottle 2011 version.  The beer pours with a deep brown appearance and a fairly tight tan head.  The beer has a little bit of toffee and some stewed fruit in addition to having a rich dark malt base. Some soft pepper and a little bit of light rum and plum character. There is a little bit of light mintiness in addition to a rich plum pudding character. Nice lingering sweetness.

(Bottled, 0.75l) Hazy dark brown with almost no head. Sourish-malty aroma with some roastiness and spices. Sweet and nutty-malty flavor with moderate roastiness, hints of coffee, and some ash. Medium body, lowish carbonation. Not bad, but maybe "too sweet and caramely in the wrong way" for me.

Bottled vintage 2009 (PBF). 
Dark nut brown color, small beige head. Dark sugar, green beans, plum and something like milk chocolate in the nose. Crisp, quite alcoholic. Lots of caramel, toasted malts, very sweet for being doppelbock. Long toasted caramelly and a bit alcoholic aftertaste.

Dark brown pour, minimal head. Aroma of brown sugar, caramel, and dark fruit. Flavor is nice, with a great sweet malt character and great spices. Palate is sweet and sticky, but not cloying. Solid dopplebock.
Dark brown pour with slight head.  Caramel malts int he aroma, nice sweet burnt and raisin notes.  The mouth is a nice dry caramel malt with some fruit notes and a slight chewiness.  Tastey

Dark brown, almost black pour with minimal off white head. Aroma is raisin and caramel malt with tons of dark fruit and caramelized sugar. Some slight citrus is evident. Flavor is                           roasty but sweet caramel and toffee malt with an excellent dark fruit character and a chocolate malt finish. Palate is full with mlid carbonation and dry finish. Quite nice.

2009 edition. Pours a reddish brown with a foaming white head of generous dimensions. Malty aroma, with a richness and a bit boozy. Above average mouthfeel. It is a rich malting that leads to a taste climax of much sweetness. The bomber must be shared.

Looks great. Beige head, deep brown colour. Great lacing. Aroma of chocolate, malt, and dark fruits. The flavour is very strong and alcoholic. Chocolate, dark fruit malt, and bread. The alcohol really detracts from the flavour.

Big bottle "Spring 2009" edition. Very dark brown with a thin brown head. Aroma of molasses, brown sugar and alcohol combines like black maple. Sugary dark flavour with brown sugar, molasses and a little soy sauce. Almost like drinking a marinade. I want a steak to go with it.

Bottle. Almost opaque brown read with a very thick foamy mocha head. Great retention and good lacing. Aroma is wood, smoke, roasted malt, nuts and bread. Flavor is toasted malt, alcohol, wood, hops, raisins, bread, and a hint of roasted malt, Full Body. A very good brew.

Tap @ Mondial de la Biere 2009 
Appearance:  quiet dark brown with fine creamy , beige top. 3+Nose:  Roasty character , mocha , bit dry for doppelbock style. Dark malts.6+Flavor/Palate : Strong character of roasted feel. Good solid malt body. Creamy with roasted accents, slightly earthy. Good but not really to the style.13+/20

Bottle. Rich mahogony beer with a light tan head. Roasty, toffee aroma with malt. Big toffee/caramel flavor with roastiness and nutiness and a bit of licorice and dark fruit. Fuller bodied. Caramel/toffee lingers with roast and a bit of earthiness

BLACK pour, quite a bit darker than i expected Aroma of sweet malt, and some peppery alcohol. The flavor was sweet, and a sort of tangy. This is not as malty as i expected. There is more of a vinous port wine flavor than the malt bomb i was expecting. Still very good, but a little off he style for my taste.

Bouteille 750ml (2007). De couleur brune-rouge foncée et claire. Nez malté de caramel légèrement rôti et aux notes terreuses, moyennement fruité (raisins aux petites notes vineuses, léger de figues et de prunes), léger de houblon herbeux (notes florales et résineuses), de chocolat, de biscuits et avec des notes boisées. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture riche, crémeuse et aux petites notes sirupeuses. Moyen goût de levures fruitées (raisins légèrement vineux, notes de figues et de prunes) et accompagné de notes de fumée de bois lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de malt moyennement rôti, moyen de caramel toffee ainsi quun léger goût de chocolat noir et de biscuits (quelques traces de sirop dérable). Parallèlement, lon retrouve un léger goût dalcool aux notes réchauffantes ainsi quune moyenne amertume asséchante de houblon herbeux aux faibles notes terreuses jusquen finale, où lon retrouve également un léger goût boisé (notes de fût de chêne) et de petites notes de noix et de café. Post-goût moyen-long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de rôti, de houblon herbeux (notes terreuses), léger de levures fruitées (moût de raisins) et avec des notes de chocolat et dalcool.

In short: Above average Doppelbock, true to the style.  Nourishing and complex malt character.
How: Bottle 750ml (many), fresh to 3 months old.
The look: Dark burgundy body topped by a beige ring of foam
In long: Complex malt profile that has a lot going, toasted raisins, earthy and woody notes, figs, maple, berries and red grapes.  A bizarre sensation of chewing on a wet fruit-flavoured cigar.  Theres some woody/oak flavours in there that are stronger than in many oak-aged beers, and this one isnt.  A little sticky and vinous.  Resinous hops and a crisp hard-candy sensation in the finish.  A sipper.  This is to me exactly what a Doppelbock should be although Im far from an expert in the style.  Doppelbock are usually not my thing so you should take my comments with a grain of salt.  I myself take everything with a grain of salt, thats why I have clogged arteries and high blood pressure.

Dark brown with orange suggestions. Large, uniform, compact initial head slowly gives way. Strong and just very malty nose. I think this contained something like 10 different cereals and its a malt medley indeed. At this young age, the alcohol gives a warming kick, but it does not appear too strong thanks to a friendly accompanying fruitiness that ranges from figs to curranty cabernet grape. Toastiness might be its malts founding father, but its tentacular proliferation ventured into as various field as almond skin, chocolate, maple. If it apparently attenuated a bit more than it was intended to, the body remains dense and filling, despite the active and cleansing carbonation. Authentic and balancing earthy/leafy noble hops in suitable proportions. It is tough to say what would make it more pleasant as it is both clean and rich. Still, I could mention that my very very favourite doppelbocks tended to show a complexity that is even greater and with certainly fewer ingredients. Perhaps time has something to do with it. A velvety nature was also a common factor to them whereas here, the carbonation, albeit never agressive, feels a bit more detached. Also, perhaps, my very favourite doppelbocks tended to have an immediate identity, putting your nose in the glass, you were hinted at which beer youre drinking, there was a perfume associated to the malt labyrinth and layered toastiness. This is not yet here. So what do we have then? Another exquisite, clean, solid staple, offered at a most reasonable price - an additional argument at this brewerys tremendous progress. Confidence is now clearly established.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2009 My Bottom Line:
A nourishing malt baguette sustains a classy fieldberry caramel and  meditating herbal hops in this highly affable yet chewy Doppelbock.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-Fluffy foam floats atop a burgundy with fiery orange highlights.
-Some light roastiness peeks through the fresh crusty bread.
-The active carbonation softens up early enough while alleviating the malty heft.
-All malt flavors coalesce intelligently.
-No alcohol is apparent in the flavor profile, which is great.
-The body is subservient and lean for a beer this gravity, letting itself be consumed effortlessly.
-This one is going to grow luxurious, I can feel it.
